metadata.Title: CVE-2018-20024 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
LibVNC before commit 4a21bbd097ef7c44bb000c3bd0907f96a10e4ce7 contains nullpointer dereference in VNC client code that can result DoS.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-20024` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvncclient1 - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.3
libvncserver-config - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.3
libvncserver1 - 0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

italc-client - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
italc-management-console - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
italc-master - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
libitalccore - 1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

ssvnc - 1.9.29-2+deb8u1build0.16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: libvncserver package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.9.10+dfsg-3ubuntu0.16.04.3').
italc package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:2.0.2+dfsg1-4ubuntu0.1').
ssvnc package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.9.29-2+deb8u1build0.16.04.1').
